The claim originated from a hoax article: com in August 2017, which has a history of producing sensationalist and false news.
The article falsely stated that the U: S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) had issued warnings about a shipment of Zika-contaminated bananas in 2017, 2018, or 2019.
The photograph used in the hoax article: contaminated banana was actually a picture of a wild banana with large seeds, taken from the website FusariumWilt.org.
